Directions
Place salami, pancetta, buttermilk powder, paprika, Fresno pepper, 2 Calabrian peppers (or 1 1/2 teaspoons chopped Calabrian peppers), and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process until a semi-smooth paste forms, 15 to 30 seconds, scraping down sides of processor as needed (paste should be even, but red pepper pieces should remain clearly visible.) Taste for heat and add additional Calabrian peppers if desired. If needed, add olive oil 1 teaspoon at a time and pulse until mixture reaches a just-spreadable consistency.
Serious Eats / Andrew Janjigian
Transfer to a container and refrigerate until firm, at least two hours. Serve or use as desired.
Serious Eats / Andrew Janjigian
Special Equipment
Food processor
Notes
Look for a Genoa salami with a soft consistency (you should be able to compress it easily with your fingertip).
If Calabrian hot peppers are unavailable, add cayenne pepper, 1/8 teaspoon at a time, until the desired heat level is achieved.
Make-Ahead and Storage
Faux 'nduja can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 10 days.
